sub_topic: Finding the determinant of a matrix
message_1: Calculate the determinant of the matrix \begin{bmatrix} 3 & 2 & 1 \\ 0 & 3 & 4 \\ 1 & 0 & 2 \end{bmatrix}.
message_2:
To calculate the determinant of a 3x3 matrix, we can use the formula:

`determinant = a(ei - fh) - b(di - fg) + c(dh - eg)`

where a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, and i are the elements of the matrix:

\begin{bmatrix} a & b & c \\ d & e & f \\ g & h & i \end{bmatrix}

In this case, the matrix is:

\begin{bmatrix} 3 & 2 & 1 \\ 0 & 3 & 4 \\ 1 & 0 & 2 \end{bmatrix}

So, a = 3, b = 2, c = 1, d = 0, e = 3, f = 4, g = 1, h = 0, and i = 2.

Now, we can plug these values into the formula:

determinant = 3(3*2 - 4*0) - 2(0*2 - 4*1) + 1(0*0 - 3*1)
determinant = 3(6 - 0) - 2(0 - 4) + 1(0 - 3)
determinant = 3(6) + 2(4) - 3
determinant = 18 + 8 - 3
determinant = 23

So, the determinant of the given matrix is 23.
